results.title: African odyssey: the two worlds of Musembe
results.creator_credit: Albert Waller and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: The two worlds of 11 year-old Musembe are the two worlds of 20th century Africa: the modern city where Musembe and his parents live in a large apartment building, and the primitive village where his civil servant father was born. A journey “home” - back to the family’s village - shows us the natural beauty of Kenya and gives a very human insight into the decisions which confront many Africans today. Musembe feels drawn to the village, and the tribal customs but his father reminds him, “We are city people now”, and we realize the emotional conflicts which come with rapid social change.

results.title: African odyssey: the red bicycle
results.creator_credit: Albert Waller and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: The travels of a red bicycle, assembled in Nairobi, enable us to learn about economic life in Africa, as it passes to a succession of owners. A tribal chief visiting the city buys it for his son and takes it back to his village in the bush. Subsequently, it is acquired by a young farmer, a government coffee tester, some tourists on safari, and eventually returned to the original village, where its parts are broken up and shared by everyone.

results.title: African city: contrasting cultures
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardonyi, Clifford Janoff and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Discusses the great contrasts of culture, life style and economic well being in the African city of Abidjan on the Ivory Coast. Shows the two distinct areas which represent the dichotomy between the poor and the wealthy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Gardonyi, Clifford Janoff and Bailey Film Productions

results.title: Africa alive
results.brief_description: Africa is a continent of mystery and beauty known for the splendour and grandeur of its wildlife which is under threat by poachers decimating the continent’s elephant and rhinoceros populations. “Africa Alive” reveals modern Africa in all its guises; its timeless beauty and its many characters. The expedition travels coastal Africa in a traditional vessel to capture the the soul and spirit of this distinctive land.

The expedition travels coastal Africa in a traditional vessel to capture the the soul and spirit of this distinctive land.

results.title: Africa : village on stilts
results.creator_credit: Denis Hargrave, UNICEF and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Depicts the tribal traditions in a typical fishing village in the Republic of Dahomey, Africa, where the houses are built high on stilts above the water. Features Nicolas an 11 year old boy, as he goes to school, swims, plays and helps his father. Also shows how the piping in of clean drinking water helped reduce the death rate from cholera and other water-borne diseases. Narrated by Percy Rodriguez.

Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Afghanistan: the dark ages
results.creator_credit: Katharine Quarmby, Caroline Pare, Tom Giles and BBC
results.brief_description: Part of the BBC Panorama television series, this documentary presents a personalised view of Afghanistan spanning the years 1989 through to 2001 by reporter John Simpson. Simpson has made many trips to Afghanistan, his first being in 1989 when the Soviet Union was finally withdrawing its soldiers after ten long years of a bloody war of occupation. Through graphic images (including smuggled footage), interviews with President Najibullah (Soviet installed leader of Afghanistan who was eventually overthrown by the Mujahideen in 1992), Ahmad Shah Masood (former Head of Afghan Armed Forces), and personal stories from Afghan women and children, and Afghan men from the various warring factions, John Simpson manages to untangle the complicated web of the brutality and wars which have dominated Afghanistan for so long. He provides a background history of Osama Bin Laden; the US involvement in arming and training the Mujahideen and the fundamentalist extremists; the invasion of Kabul by the Mujahideen and the subsequent attempts by the Northern Alliance to overthrow the US backed Mujahideen; the eventual removal of the moderates in the Afghan government and the takeover of Kabul by a new movement called the Taliban who had already conquered the south of Afghanistan. The Taliban, with their extreme Islamic fundamentalism, turned Kabul back to the dark ages with their strict laws, public executions, ethnic cleansing and making women into non-existent beings by ordering them to stay at home or cover themselves in the burqua denying them access to schools or any form of education. Simpson also touches briefly on September 11, 2001, Osama Bin Laden and Al Queda and where to now for Afghanistan as the US and their allies set about to destroy and remove the Taliban from Kabul. A moving, at times distressing, insight into the plight of the down-trodden war-torn citizens of Afghanistan. Photography by cameraman Peter Jouvenal.

results.title: Aesop's fables. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Aesops fables (stories designed to teach a moral lesson) is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The 18 stories on this tape are short and to the point. The tapes primary intent is to instruct rather than entertain, and short interludes between each story may be used by the teacher to generate discussion with the students on the stories they have just seen and heard. Fables include: The Shepherd boy and the Wolf ; The Fox and the grapes ; The Hare and the Tortoise ; The Cat and the Mouse ; The Hare and the Hound ; The Raven and the Swan and The lion, the ass and the fox.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Beginners
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: The 30 minute “Beginners” program is at a gently demanding pace and is suitable for anyone who has not been actively involved in an exercise program within the past three months. Rated: G
